definitions.text: a swift whirling motion (usually of a missile)

examples: he gave the crank a spin
it broke off after much twisting

definitions.text: a short drive in a car
examples: he took the new car for a spin

definitions.text: rapid descent of an aircraft in a steep spiral
a distinctive interpretation (especially as used by politicians to sway public opinion)
examples: the campaign put a favorable spin on the story

definitions.text: revolve quickly and repeatedly around one's own axis
examples: The dervishes whirl around and around without getting dizzy
The creek spun its course through the woods

definitions.text: form a web by making a thread
work natural fibers into a thread
twist and turn so as to give an intended interpretation
examples: The President's spokesmen had to spin the story to make it less embarrassing
